c74object.name: fl.lookupstring~
c74object.digest: Lookup a specified string from an internally stored list of strings
c74object.description: The string can be specified by index or normalised value. The first number at the input is used to specify the string. The number of stored items can be set explicitly by parameter. Alternatively, it can be set implicitly by the parameters present at instantiation. Items may be dynamically updated by parameter.

entry.name: /num_items [int]
entry.description: INSTANTIATION ONLYSets the number of items.

entry.name: /scale [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the input scale:
[0] - indices - string lookup is done by index.[1] - normalised - string lookup is done by normalised value.

entry.name: /empty [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the behaviour when empty frames are received:
[0] - ignore - empty frames are ignored.[1] - reset - empty frames create empty tags to reset parameters to defaults.

entry.name: /item_01...32 [string]
entry.description: Sets the string for item N [1-32].

objarg.name: tag
objarg.description:
This argument sets the tag parameter:
Sets the output tag.

objarg.name: item_01...32
objarg.digest: Sets the string for item N [1-32]
objarg.description:
Arguments set parameters item_01...32:
Sets the string for item N [1-32].

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.lookupstring~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.lookupstring~. When set to 0 fl.lookupstring~ forms part of a non-realtime network for performing offline processing in Max message threads. This mode of operation uses buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.lookupstring~ in order to determine distinct processing contexts.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
